column4: Hello, I just installed Ubuntu, and I cannot get it to communicate on my network
Ifconfig reports the eth0 as UP, and my DNS servers are reported, but I have no Internet
what do you mean? Its connected to the school system
/sbin/ifconfig should tell u your IP adrs.
Its being reported in base16, which is unusual.
should be a dotted quad, unless you're talking about the MAC adrs.
I've never seen that. eth0 should have 'inet addr:xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx' as 2nd line.
oh, maybe that's ipv6!  I never seen that.  No clue.
first I'd look in the man page for ifconfig to see if you can get that reported normally etc.
This isn't quite related, but it may put you onto the right idea:  cat /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward
I'd trace the entire boot procedure, starting with /etc/inittab
Linux wants a bit of massaging.
no one knows, but we all do it.
